trait.name: Charge
entries: If the goat moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Amphibious.
entries: The sea goat can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell.
entries: The sea goat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Aparência Falsa
entries: Enquanto o sentinela saguaro estiver imóvel, ele é indistinguível de um Saguaro Gigante normal.

trait.name: Monstro de Cerco
entries: O sentinela saguaro causa dano dobrado a objetos e estruturas.

trait.name: Corpo Espinhoso
entries: Uma criatura que tocar o sentinela saguaro ou acertá-lo com um ataque corpo-a-corpo enquanto a 5 pés de distância da criatura recebe 5 ({@dice 1d10}) pontos de dano.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: O sentinela saguaro faz 4 ataques com seus socos espinhosos ou abraços perfurantes em qualquer combinação. O sentinela não pode realizar um soco espinhoso com um braço que agarra uma criatura.

action.name: Soco Espinhoso
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} para acertar, alcance 5 ft., um alvo. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Abraço Perfurante
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} para acertar, alcance 5 ft., um alvo. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) dano perfurante. Se o alvo for uma criatura de tamanho Médio ou menor, ela está agarrada (escape CD 16). O sentinela saguaro tem 4 braços, cada um consegue agarrar somente um alvo. Uma vez agarrado, o sentinela saguaro não consegue utilizar esse braço para realizar um soco espinhoso. O sentinela saguaro tem vantagem para atacar uma criatura agarrada pelo abraço perfurante.

action.name: Jato dágua (Recarrega 5-6)
entries: O sentinela saguaro cospe violentamente um jato de água em uma linha de 40 ft de distância e 5ft. de largura. Cada criatura nessa linha deve fazer uma salvaguarda de Destreza CD 16, recebendo 22 ({@damage 4d10}) pontos de dano hídrico em uma falha e metade em um sucesso. As criaturas que falharem serão empurradas 10 ft e estarão {@condition prone}

Treants are awakened trees that dwell in ancient forests. Although treants prefer to while away the days, months, and years in quiet contemplation, they fiercely protect their woodland demesnes from outside threats.

entries.name: The Sleeping Tree Awakens
entries: A tree destined to become a treant meditates through a long cycle of seasons, living normally for decades or centuries before realizing its potential. Trees that awaken do so only under special circumstances and in places steeped with nature's magic. Treants and powerful druids can sense when a tree has the spark of potential, and they protect such trees in secret groves as they draw near the moment of their awakening. During the long process of awakening, a tree acquires face-like features in its bark, a division of the lower trunk into legs, and long branches bending downward to serve as its arms. When it is ready, the tree pulls its legs free from the clutching earth and joins its fellows in protecting its woodland home.

entries.name: Legendary Guardians
entries: After a treant awakens, it continues to grow exactly as it did when it was a tree. Treants created from the mightiest trees can reach great sizes while developing an innate magical power over plants and animals. Such treants can animate plants, using them to ensnare and trap intruders. They can call wild creatures to aid them or carry messages across great distances.

entries.name: Protectors of the Wild
entries: Even after awakening, a treant spends much of its time living as a tree. While rooted in place, a treant remains aware of its surroundings, and can perceive the effects of events taking place miles away based on subtle changes nearby.

Woodcutters who avoid culling healthy living trees and hunters who take only what they need of the forest's bounty are unlikely to arouse a treant's ire. Creatures careless with fire, those who poison the forest, and those who destroy great trees, especially a tree close to awakening, face the treant's wrath.

trait.name: Nadador das Areias
entries: O verme das areias consegue se mover pelas areias do deserto sem gerar grandes perturbações na superfície. Testes para encontrar um verme das areias são feitos com desvantagem.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: O verme faz um com sua mordida e um com a onda de areia.

action.name: Mordida
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} para acertar, alcance 10 ft., um alvo. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) pontos de dano perfurante. Se o alvo for uma criatura Grande ou menor, ele deve passar em um save de Destreza {@dc 19} ou será engolido pelo verme. Uma criatura engolida está {@condition blinded} e {@condition restrained}, tem {@quickref Cover||3||cobertura total} contra ataques e outros efeitos fora do verme e recebe 21 ({@damage 6d6}) pontos de dano ácido no início de cada um dos turnos do verme.

Se o verme receber 30 pontos de dano ou mais de uma criatura dentro dele em um único turno, o verme deve passar em uma salvaguarda de Constituição {@dc 21} no fim daquele turno ou regurgitaá todas as criaturas engolidas, que caem  {@condition prone} em um espaço a 10ft do verme. Se o verme morre, uma criatura engolida não estará mais {@condition restrained} por ele e pode escapar do corpo gastando 20 ft. de movimento, saindo {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The massive burrowing monster known as the purple worm terrorizes the creatures of the Underdark as it chews through solid rock in pursuit of prey. A dimwitted, ravenous force of nature, this creature regards anything it encounters as food.

entries.name: Ravenous Hunters
entries: Loud noise attracts purple worms, which have been known to interrupt underground battles and tear through subterranean cities seeking prey. The underground civilizations of the drow, the duergar, and the mind flayers maintain special wards around their settlements to deter these monsters.

Though most common in the Underdark, purple worms are frequently seen on the surface world in rocky and mountainous lands. The maw of a purple worm is large enough to swallow a horse whole, and no creature is safe from its hunger. It lunges forward by rhythmically compressing and expanding its body, catching other Underdark dwellers by surprise with the speed of its advance.

entries.name: Boons of the Worm
entries: When a purple worm burrows through the ground, it consumes earth and rock, which it breaks down and constantly excretes. Precious metals and gems can thus be found within the bodies of purple worms, which are targeted by particularly brave and foolhardy treasure hunters.

A burrowing purple worm constantly creates new tunnels throughout the Underdark, which are quickly made use of by other creatures as corridors and highways. Because a purple worm rarely returns to its own tunnels, such passageways are a good place to avoid these monsters. Areas rich in prey quickly become interlaced with complex tunnel systems resulting from several worms hunting together.

trait.name: Visão e Olfato Aguçados
entries: O pavão daakiri tem vantagem em testes de Sabedoria({@skill Perception}) que dependam de visão ou de olfato.

trait.name: Táticas de Matilha
entries: O pavão tem vantagem em uma jogada de ataque contra uma criatura se ao menos um dos aliados do pavão estiverem a até 5 pés de distância da criatura alvo e se o aliado não estiver  {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Cactícola
entries: O pavão daakiri é imune ao efeito de {@hazard razorvine } de uma floresta de cactos.

action.name: Bicada
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} para acertar, alcance 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage

action.name: Cauda Espinhosa  {@recharge}
entries: O pavão sacode sua cauda, lançando uma saraivada de agulhas em um cone de 15 pés. Cada criatura na área deve fazer uma salvaguarda de Destreza {@dc 11}, recebendo 7 ({@damage 2d6}) pontos de dano lígneo em caso de falha ou metade disso em caso de sucesso.

trait.name: Sensitividade à Luz Solar
entries: Enquanto em luz solar, o kobold tem desvantagem em rolagens de ataque, bem como em Testes de Sabedoria ({@skill Perception}) que dependam da visão.

trait.name: Táticas de Matilha
entries: O kobold tem vantagem em uma jogada de ataque contra uma criatura se ao menos um dos aliados do pavão estiverem a até 5 pés de distância da criatura alvo e se o aliado não estiver  {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Resistência Rathsythirani
entries: O kobold tem resistência a dano lígneo.

action.name: Maça-Estrela
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} para acertar, alcance 5 ft., um alvo. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) pontos de dano perfurante.

action.name: Saraivada de Espinhos
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} para acertar, alcance 30/120 ft., um alvo. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) pontos de dano lígneo.

Kobolds are craven reptilian humanoids that worship evil dragons as demigods and serve them as minions and toadies. Kobolds inhabit dragons' lairs when they can but more commonly infest dungeons, gathering treasures and trinkets to add to their own tiny hoards.

entries.name: Strength in Numbers
entries: Kobolds are egg-laying creatures. They mature quickly and can live to be "great wyrms" more than a century old. However, many kobolds perish before they reach the end of their first decade. Physically weak, they are easy prey for predators. This vulnerability forces them to band together. Their superior numbers can win battles against powerful adversaries, but often with massive casualties on the kobold side.

entries.name: Tunnelers and Builders
entries: Kobolds make up for their physical ineptitude with a cleverness for trap making and tunneling. Their lairs consist of low tunnels through which they move easily but which hinder larger humanoids. Kobolds also riddle their lairs with traps. The most insidious kobold traps make use of natural hazards and other creatures. A trip wire might connect to a spring-loaded trap that hurls clay pots of flesh-eating green slime or flings crates of venomous giant centipedes at intruders.

entries.name: The Lost God
entries: In addition to the dragons they revere, kobolds worship a lesser god named Kurtulmak. Legends speak of how Kurtulmak served as Tiamat's vassal in the Nine Hells until Garl Glittergold, the god of gnomes, stole a trinket from the Dragon Queen's hoard. Tiamat sent Kurtulmak to retrieve the trinket, but Garl Glittergold played a trick on him, collapsing the earth and trapping the kobold god in an underground maze for eternity. For this reason, kobolds hate gnomes and pranks of any kind. Kurtulmak's most devoted worshipers dedicate themselves to finding and releasing their lost god from his prison-maze.
